page.title: 13LAW AND ORDER
page.content: There is little crime in the Stourmouth area and the police are rarely called. Locals believe that most crimes such as burglary are the work of{outsiders}who see weekend cottages as easy prey. The{caravan {site}at Plucks Gutter does occasionally come under police scrutiny however. Police theory seems to be that a transient holiday community is an ideal hide-out for men on the run. One{notable incident involved the hunt for a{Great Train {Robber.}Customers at the Dog and Duck noticed a group of men in ultra-countrified cloths. All had dogs, wore tweeds, cords and 'funny hats',some even had strings tied round their trousers legs below the knee. All pretended not to know one another. At last they revealed themselves as 'plain-cloths policeman'
